channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Morality matters, even to Cuomo voters
item.description: In the latest elections, 2 million New Yorkers voted. But for some, the choice left a lingering sense of discomfort.

item.title: South Korean banks offer baby bonuses, flexible schedules, and years-long sabbaticals while U.S. women leave the workforce in droves
item.description: Some South Korean banks are offering “parental resignation” programs while America’s RTO shift is forcing women out of their jobs.

item.title: NBC’s ‘Stumble’: Why does Hollywood insist on treating narcolepsy as a punchline?
item.description: NBC recently debuted a new show: Stumble , a comedy about a former cheer coach leading a team of misfits. Some earlier reviews of the show, which prem...

item.title: Trump tells Scott Bessent to fix the Fed’s high interest rates or ‘I’m going to fire your ass’
item.description: The president also disclosed for the first time that Bessent has been advocating for Powell to remain as chair until his term expires in May.

item.title: Giving Feedback Is a Skill. How Can You Hone It?
item.description: Greenhouse CEO Daniel Chait talks feedback with Wagmo’s Christie Horvath

item.title: Why Is Performance Management So Hard?
item.description: Hiring the right person is only the beginning. Performance management can make or break your company.

item.title: Home Depot blames its recent sales slump on a major funk in the housing market: ‘Our customers are homeowners’
item.description: The U.S. housing market is currently experiencing historic stagnation.

item.title: Children’s Advocacy Group Urges Families Not to Buy This Type of Toy for the Holidays
item.description: At issue are concerns about sensitive data and foundational activities like imaginative play time being replaced.

item.title: Verizon begins laying off more than 13,000 employees in a bid to ‘reorient’ the entire company
item.description: Verizon is laying off more than 13,000 employees in mass job reductions that arrive as the telecommunications giant says it must “reorient” its entire...

item.title: This Massive Ice Cream Chain Closed Nearly Every Location—Now It’s Making a Big Comeback
Exclusive: Former BlackRock employees raise $4.6 million for HelloTrade, a blockchain-powered trading platform
item.description: The startup aims to allow people around the world to invest in traditional U.S. assets using crypto technology

item.title: How to Fix Performance Management Before It Breaks Your Team
item.description: From radical candor to smarter goal-setting, discover what companies like Adobe got right, and why investing in managers changes everything.

item.title: Vance tells Americans to have ‘a little bit of patience’ on high prices
item.description: While President Donald Trump has struggled to settle on a way to address Americans’ concerns about high costs , Vice President JD Vance on Thursday of...

item.title: Why Trump’s AI diplomacy is doomed to fail
item.description: This week, chips were on the menu in the White House. “When you ask about AI and chips, Saudi Arabia has a huge need for computing power,” Crown Princ...

item.title: Even the Nvidia market rally couldn’t save Bitcoin’s price: BTC sinks to new low today. What’s up with this crypto crash?
item.description: Is this the beginning of the end for Bitcoin? A Bitcoin ( BTC ) sell-off on Thursday is sending the cryptocurrency down again today by 3% to $86,410.5...
